page.title: 01UP HATHERLEY & CHURCHDOWN
page.content: The area originally consisted of three villages and their farmland.{Up {Hatherley}and{Churchdown}have grown considerably to form dormitory suburbs for Cheltenham and Gloucester, {Badgeworth}has remained tiny, undeveloped village. { Farming}is still very important,there being about six working farms,mostly given over to grazing beef and dairy cattle.Much land has been lost to {housing development}since 1960 and plans are in hand for a great deal more. { Transport}is a dominent feature.The M5 Motorway has a large interchange with the A40 London to South Wales road.This tends to cause many traffic problems in the area.The railway line from Birmingham to the South West is parallel to the A40.There is also the small regional airport at Staverton.
